meanings.definition: Remove buds from (a plant) to improve growth or appearance.
meanings.sent1: I will disbud the rose bush to help it grow better.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners often disbud plants to make them look neater.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to disbud all the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: She carefully disbudded the plant, like removing obstacles for its growth.
meanings.sent5: Disbudding the plant felt like giving it a fresh start.

meanings.definition: Prevent the development of buds on (a plant).
meanings.sent1: To avoid overgrowth, we need to disbud the tree regularly.
meanings.sent2: It is important to disbud fruit trees to control their growth.
meanings.sent3: The gardener joked that he would disbud the plant if it misbehaved.
meanings.sent4: She disbudded the plant, halting its plans to bloom.
meanings.sent5: Disbudding the plant early saved it from becoming too crowded.

meanings.definition: Remove the buds from (a plant) to prevent flowering.
meanings.sent1: If we disbud the orchid now, it won't bloom too soon.
meanings.sent2: Disbudding roses can redirect the plant's energy to other areas.
meanings.sent3: The gardener decided to disbud the plant as a prank on his friend.
meanings.sent4: She disbudded the plant, stopping its plans to blossom.
meanings.sent5: Disbudding the plant felt like delaying its grand reveal.
